message.content:
cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with computational game theory, specifically the problems of computing a Nash equilibrium and opponent exploitation. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Game Theory (cs.GT) category. Additionally, the paper discusses Bayesian methods and algorithms, which are commonly studied in the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) category. The use of prior distributions and algorithms for best-responding also suggests a connection to the Learning (cs.LG) category. The paper also presents an exact algorithm for a class of imperfect-information games, which may be of interest to researchers in the Data Structures (cs.DS) category. Finally, the paper involves integration and probability theory, which may indicate a connection to the Information Theory (cs.IT) category.
